summaryText: Wow, what an incredible message about rebuilding our lives in 2023! Pastor Tommy 'Urban D' Kyllonen delivered a powerful sermon from the book of Nehemiah, challenging Impact Church to embrace a year of transformation. Drawing from Nehemiah's story, he shared five 'rebuilding block prayers' that can radically change our approach to life: developing compassion, admitting when we're wrong, allowing God to break and remake us, listening to divine instructions, and following through with courage. The most inspiring part? The real-life stories of compassion, like Travis's viral social media ministry helping people in need. Pastor Tommy reminded us that God doesn't call the qualified, He qualifies the called! His spoken word piece about 'reframing' our perspective was particularly powerful, showing how changing our mental frames can totally transform our outlook. The sermon was a bold invitation to step out in faith, believe God's promises, and watch Him do miraculous things in our lives. As Pastor Tommy said, 'I dare you to do what God is calling you to do in this new year!'
mainPoints: God wants to rebuild and reshape us in 2023
Compassion and listening are key to following God's instructions

versesMentioned.text: Nehemiah asked about the Jews who had returned from exile and learned about their troubles. He sat down and wept, mourning for days, praying and fasting to the God of Heaven.

Monday.scripture: Jeremiah 29:11: 'For I know the plans I have for you,' declares the Lord, 'plans to prosper you and not to harm you, plans to give you hope and a future.'
Monday.focus: Understanding God's rebuilding process in our lives
Monday.action: Reflect on areas of your life where you need God's reconstruction. Write down three specific areas and pray over them, asking God to guide your rebuild process.
Monday.prayer: Lord, I surrender these areas of my life to You. Break down what needs to be broken and rebuild me according to Your perfect plan. Give me courage to trust Your process. Amen.

Tuesday.scripture: Isaiah 43:19: 'See, I am doing a new thing! Now it springs up; do you not perceive it? I am making a way in the wilderness and streams in the wasteland.'
Tuesday.focus: Developing compassion and awareness of needs around us
Tuesday.action: Intentionally look for one person you can help today, whether through a small act of kindness, prayer, or practical assistance.
Tuesday.prayer: God, open my eyes to the needs around me. Give me a heart of compassion and the courage to take action. Show me how I can be Your hands and feet today. Amen.

Wednesday.scripture: Philippians 3:13-14: 'Brothers and sisters, I do not consider myself yet to have taken hold of it. But one thing I do: Forgetting what is behind and straining toward what is ahead, I press on toward the goal to win the prize for which God has called me heavenward in Christ Jesus.'
Wednesday.focus: Reframing our perspective and letting go of past limitations
Wednesday.action: Identify one negative thought pattern or belief that has held you back. Write it down and replace it with a biblical truth about who you are in Christ.
Wednesday.prayer: Father, help me see myself and my circumstances through Your perspective. Break down mental barriers and help me embrace the new thing You're doing in my life. Amen.

Thursday.scripture: Proverbs 3:5-6: 'Trust in the Lord with all your heart and lean not on your own understanding; in all your ways submit to him, and he will make your paths straight.'
Thursday.focus: Learning to listen and follow God's instructions
Thursday.action: Set aside dedicated time for prayer and listening. Journal any impressions or guidance you receive from God.
Thursday.prayer: Lord, quiet my heart and help me listen. Speak to me clearly and give me the courage to obey Your instructions, even when they seem challenging. Amen.

Friday.scripture: 1 Samuel 16:7: 'The Lord does not look at the things people look at. People look at the outward appearance, but the Lord looks at the heart.'
Friday.action: Ask a trusted friend or mentor to give you honest feedback about your character. Be open to hearing areas where you can grow.
Friday.prayer: God, help me prioritize my character development. Show me areas where I need to grow to become more like Jesus. Give me humility and a teachable spirit. Amen.

Saturday.scripture: Romans 12:2: 'Do not conform to the pattern of this world, but be transformed by the renewing of your mind. Then you will be able to test and approve what God's will is—his good, pleasing and perfect will.'
Saturday.action: Review the week's insights. Create a specific, actionable plan for one area of personal growth you want to focus on in the coming month.
Saturday.prayer: Lord, I commit this season of rebuilding to You. Transform my mind, heart, and actions. Help me be bold in following Your leading and trusting Your process. Amen.
